Will this be "only" for folders within owncloud? Or should this also work for every directory on the phone?

title: Photo downloads consistently fail
body:
I use OC to store my photos organized in a folder hierarchy. The Android app syncs the filesystem data just fine -- I can see my photos, including thumbnails -- but when I go to view or download a photo, the "Downloading" progress bar pops up, sits for a few seconds, and then gives me a black screen with an exclamation mark and "Download failed". It also displays a download failed notification.

I've checked the server and it doesn't write an error message on the server side.

This seems to happen consistently. I have never successfully downloaded or viewed a photo using the app.

I found one forum post suggesting that I should reduce the size of my quota. I set it to 100GB, the recommended size by the post, but the problem still persists.

title: Add open .url file and share from web browser
body:
Add open .url file and share from web browser
This PR is update PR from #1270.

.url file is shortcut of url(like http://...).
When you click .url file on owncloud app, app opens web browser.
When you share on web browser with owncloud app, .url file is uploaded.

This is very useful to web surfing overlap desktop PCs and smart phones.
In addition, .webloc and plain/text are handled.

title: Video not uploaded to OC from mobile
body:
### Actual behaviour

I'm running OC8.2 on headless Debian Server (Trusty) with MySQL. I am running OwnClient Android appli on Android 5.0.2/Samsung S5: I have Instant video upload enabled on Android App, with upload via Wifi only

Image upload runs perfectly. The issue is with video.
Here is description of the issue and outcome of my investigations:
- If I'm connected on my Wifi home network with my mobile and I record a video, the video is immediately uploaded to OC. This is perfect.
- If I'm not connectd on wifi network and I record a video, this video will never be uploaded to my OC when I'm back at home, connected on my Wifi.

Additinal information  :idea: :
- I have also changed the OC folder for video upload several time (I have initially suspected that using same folder for images and videos could cause troubles), but it does not change anything.
- when a video is uploaded successfully (when I'm at home, recording and connected), I get the following error in the logs:
  Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php:70) at /var/www/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/http/lib/Sapi.php#58

First level: "On device" --> "Lokal gespeichert"

title: Synchronization has to be performed manually
body:
Hi ! 

When using the Android OwnCloud client, I have to manually select a file and click on "synchronize" otherwise, its content is not updated -- although the file properties are correctly updated in the Owncloud client.

STEPS TO PERFORM
1) perform the initial synchronization
2) for instance I have a file called todo.txt in Documents/ which is properly synced
3) I make a modification on my desktop client (KDE under Kubuntu). 
4) I make sure this is properly uploaded to the server : this is OK (checked from web interface)
5) the file is not synced on the Android device
6) I check the Owncloud client on the Android device : I can see the new filesize and new file date is displayed but when I click on the file, I can still see its former content
7) the only way to make the OC Android client sync it properly is to select "synchronize" in the file context menu

The problem is it has to be done manually each time. This is misleading as files attributes, in the OC client, are the right ones but the file content is not updated.

Using : 
- Server : Owncloud 8.1 (web4all.fr hosting)
- Desktop client : Kubuntu 14.04 LTS + Owncloud client v.2.1
- Android Phone : Samsung Galaxy Core Prime LTE ; Android 5.0.2
- Android Owncloud client : 1.9.0

Thanks to everyone involved ! Cheers !

title: Bad wording "delete account" in Android app (scares user)
body:
In the settings you’ll have to long press the username and then chose ‘delete account’ to remove a local account from the app. This is kind of a bad wording. It does remove the account from the ownCloud app but for the user this is just a ‘logout’ on this device, so that he has to type in the username/password again the next time he starts the app. This doesn't really delete the account on the server side. (which is good)

Please consider to rename this action to "logout" because ‘delete account’ sound pretty destructive.

cc @rperezb @jancborchardt @MTRichards @michaelstingl

title: Two Way Sync?
body:
### Expected behaviour

When I hit the "Synchronize" menu item, files stored locally on my device should be uploaded to the server.

Ideally, this should happen automatically.
### Actual behaviour

Files are downloaded from the server, but local changes are not uploaded.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Android app.
2. Long press on a folder.
3. Select "Synchronize"
4. The folder is stored in the local filesystem `/storage/emulated/0/owncloud/user@server/foldername/`
5. Edit one of the downloaded files - or save a new file in the folder.
6. Changes and new files are not automatically syncronised.
7. Repeat step 3.
8. Changes and new files are not automatically syncronised.

I've gone into Android's system settings - accounts - owncloud - and enabled "Sync Files".  The problem still persists.

I suppose I want the same functionality as the Linux Desktop client - the ability to selectively sync folders.  Is that possible?

If not, can this menu item be renamed "Download" rather than "Synchronize"?
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Nexus 6

Stock or customized system:  CM13

ownCloud app version: 1.9

ownCloud server version: 8.2
### Logs
#### Web server error log

N/A
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)

N/A

title: Mention CalDAV/CardDAV address somewhere in the app
body:
Currently we talk exactly _not at all_ about the Calendar and Contact syncing functionality of ownCloud. This is the cause of lots of negative reviews and people asking to integrate full-blown Calendar/Contacts sync into the app.

So to alleviate this a bit and to make it easy for people to copy/paste the address, we should do some small things in the app:
- Show the CalDAV/CardDAV address in the app settings (new section »Calendar & Contacts sync«), so they can be copied
- Advertise a CalDAV/CardDAV client, like [DAVdroid](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=at.bitfire.davdroid&hl=en) (that one is open source)
- Mention the ability for Calendar & Contacts sync in the first run slideshow.

Same for the iOS app, save for the CalDAV/CardDAV client because iOS supports that natively.

cc @karlitschek @DeepDiver1975 (as talked about) and @rperezb @MTRichards @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger

title: Settings and log should replace the content just like the files list instead of opening separate views
body: Just as said in the title. Amy reasom we do not do this at the moment?

title: Remove grey lines in sidebar
body: The whitespace is enough as separator, and the grey lines look a bit old-style. Removing them will look much better.

title: Highlight current view in sidebar, use »On device« as header title
body:
When I started the ownCloud app where I left off, I was initially confused about how little files where there. Turns out I was in the »On device« filter, with no indication.

Hence whenever the current view is a filter (anything else than »All files«), that filter should also be used as the title in the header.

Additionally, the current view should have a highlight in the sidebar. Darker icon & text for example, like we do in the web interface.

title: Background color should be white everywhere
body:
The background color of the Settings and Log sections is not white at the moment. But should be, exactly like in the file list etc.

The background should be white everywhere, except black in the image view of course. :)

title: »New folder« entry in top right 3-dot menu
body:
This seems to be duplicated from the FAB and we should remove it from that 3-dot-menu.

Also, when the sidebar is open, tapping the 3-dot menu _only_ shows the »New folder« entry, but not the other entries. Should show everything, no?

title: #1415 - semi transparent checkmark in checked checkbox image
body:
For a detailed discussion please see #1415 since the material like checkboxes (also on master) are now used for multi selection also on grid view the selected items are hard to spot on dark images sind the box is dark blue and the checkmark has been transparent. 
This PR changes the checked checkbox images with the checkmark being white with semi transparency so the checkmark can be spotted on selected grid items in case of dark images.

title: Feature request: Instant Upload to create year/month subfolders
body:
It would be great to customize the instant upload feature in a way that uploaded photos are stored in a subfolder per year/month so they will be easier to find and the InstantUpload folder stays manageable.

---

Right now users of the app can only choose one target folder and all files will be uploaded to that folder. This is obviously a very convenient thing but after a few months this folder is messed up with hundreds or thousands of images and videos - even owncloud it self has trouble loading this.

With an automatic optional subfolder `InstantUpload/<year>/<month` users would be enabled to find their files more easily and minimize the traffic when browsing images.

title: When server certificate has changed, always show certificate info. Certificate-untrusted info is not shown when syncing.
body:
My OC server uses a CAcert.org certificate (which had to be manually "trusted" after checking the fingerprint when the oc client was setup initially).

I recently updated the certificate, because it was close to expire.

When upstarting the OC Android client, or when clicking "Konto aktualisieren" (account sync), no warning information was shown (that the certificate has changed).

But when actually performing a file action like "delete file on the server" (I only tried "delete" actions), the client shows the certificate-untrusted warning, so that I then could manually check the new fingerprint and set permanent trust to the renewed connection's certificate.

I regard the following as a bug:
- certificate is not tested during syncing (certificate-has-changed information is not shown during syncing; it _is_ however tested when actually performing a file action like delete.

title: User list for sharing contains signed in user
body:
Using fdroid's owncloud beta20160109 on a Nexus 6p with PureNexus rom, I perform the following steps,
1. Long press on a folder I would like to share with another user.
2. Press the share button in the top bar.
3. Click 'Add User Or Group'.
4. Type in user's name.
5. List pops up with all users including my own.

This isn't very major, but it seems like (from what I can tell) it's unnecessary.

To keep things simple from a UI prospective we could store these folders inside the same paths selected for camera pictures.

title: Folder list is not updated when a file is uploaded
body:
and as a consequence it is impossible to upload a file to a folder that was created after the app updated the folder list.

I think it would be good if fresh folder list would be fetched withing upload file dialog (when shared from other application)

title: Enhancement: Ability to create bookmarks
body:
I think that the current concept of Favorites is somewhat misleading. I might have a "Favorite" folder that lies deep within the folder tree which I want to access quickly, but it does not necessarily mean that I want this whole folder synced on my phone. 

Would it be possible to make "Bookmarks" in the left menu part (where the access to configuration, and on device / all files switch is now) that would be merely a list of shortcuts to get us quickly deep into menu structure?

title: (optional) Delete of successful uploaded files e.g. images, videos
body:
Hi,
I noticed, that images uploaded to OC, are copied to owncloud/OC-installation/SofortUpload and that they 
are remaining there - until forever, thus still blocking urgently needed storage space on the SD-CARD .
Selecting an Option like: Delete image (video) after successful upload will make better use of the 
limited resources on a handset.

Since the image is stored in the DCIM folder as well, there is still ONE local copy available and 
not TWO copies, whereas the copy in the OC folder is only required for upload purposes.

regards, hitam4450

title: Hide FAB on multi select
body:
following up on the discussion in #1346 I was thinking it makes sense to hide the FAB when the multi select is active and show it again when multi select has been done. 

Pro:
- it removed the then unnecessary FAB since it has no actions for a multi select and could be considered clutter at this very moment

Con:
- show/hide might be confusing since it doesn't add extra functionality and might feel jumpy

Since I am not a UI/UX expert looping in @jancborchardt and also @tobiasKaminsky since it relates to the multi select discussion. What do you think? Personally I would hide it during multi select simply to "see" a list and nothing else :)

title: Thumbnail size is wrong in full screen
body:
Considering the beta app, currently we create thumbnails that look great for both the list and the grid, but when we tap and open an image, what we see is the same thumbnail that is shown inside the grid.

I think the best way to handle this situation is to show a thumbnail that looks like the original one but it's smaller (we could compress PNGs to JPGs and resize them to the screen size, so that the image size is kept low and in the same time we can't really feel a compression+size).

The original image will be downloaded when requested explicitly.

P.S. I also think that showing a compress image (in terms of format and quality only) inside the web client would be great as well.
For example I keep a huge amount of images in my owncloud, and would be great surfing on them without have to wait even more than 10s to have some of them loaded. – **EDIT:** it actually works in this way :)

Another option would be loading images progressively.

title: Resized images/Thumbnails: load them while wlan on sync
body:
Thumbnails are loaded while entering a directory.
Resized images are loaded while browsing them.

As I use 200mb cache it would be great that "all" thumbnails and "all" resized images are loaded when on wlan so that I do not have to download them while I am without wlan.

So, how can we do this?
- have an entry in settings: what if all images are bigger than the cache? Then it is useless to download newer ones as older are immediately kicked out of the cache.
- have an entry per folder which recursively downloads them? Maybe same problem as above
- automatically do this? How and what to do if the cache is to small?

@jancborchardt @AndyScherzinger @davivel

title: Idea for enhancement: indicate subfolders shared with others
body:
Right not when someone shares a folder with me, the folder is marked as shared and so are any files and subfolders within.

On the other hand when I share a folder with someone, the folder is marked as shared, but the subfolders and files within are not.

It might be useful to be reminded that I am adding files to a folder that lies within a shared folder somewhere up the tree.

Would it be too hard to add the possibility to rotate the photo? I know it could be tricky as sometimes we only have the preview, and it would only make sense, if the rotation got uploaded automatically to server, but..

What do You think?

title: Connection Problem on WLAN Networks with fast bss transition
body:
### Expected behaviour

The File should get uploaded normally (like if using only 1 AP).
### Actual behaviour

The Uploader gets stuck / does not finish. With very many APs not even a folder can be accessed in the app.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Connect to a WIFI with fast bss transition enabled (for example "eduroam" (Wifi of most universities), or other wifi networks with many access points)
2. Try to upload / auto upload a file. If the client roames in this period, the uploader gets stuck.
3. With very many APs no folder can be accessed in the app.
### Environment data

Android version: 4.3

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S3 (i9300)

Stock or customized system: Stock and Custom (occures on both)

ownCloud app version: 1.9.0

ownCloud server version: 8.2.2

title: [Beta] User list doesn't appear for sharing
body:
Using fdroid's owncloud beta151222 on a Nexus 6p with PureNexus rom, I perform the following steps,
1. Long press on a folder I would like to share with another user.
2. Press the share button in the top bar.
3. Click 'Add User Or Group'.
4. Type in user's name.
5. No list pops up and pressing the enter button does nothing.

I noticed it still works well in the stable version.  This essentially disables sharing with other users.  Thanks for any help you can provide.  I'm really enjoying beta.

title: Owncloud client warns with valid letsencrypt HTTPS certificate
body: I've just deployed a letsencrypt HTTPS certificate on my owncloud server. Firefox and Chrome are fine with the cert and can successfully validate it, however, the Owncloud Android app still issues a warning that the cert is signed by an unknown authority. A quick Google search tells me that this may be related to which Android URL API is in use, however, I can't give more details ATM. Issue occurs on Owncloud app 1.9.0.

title: Only leave application with open navigation drawer
body: Maybe this is something I got used to by other apps and I really don't know whether this is an Android-UI-Guidline or not. Currently the ownCloud-Client closes when the back button is pressed in the root folder view. Other apps, e.g. the ownCloud Newsreader, first open the navigation drawer and when pressing back a second time with the open drawer it leaves the app.

title: Quick Account-Switching in navigation drawer
body:
Currently when one has  multiple accounts in the app the only way to switch between these accounts is to open the settings and select the appropriate account.

Would it be possible to have a quicker way? e.g. from the sidebar?

title: Incomplete size in list and details view (PR 1209)
body:
PR: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1209

In list view, uploads view and details view, the size of the file is shown without decimals. In server side is shown with at least one decimal when the size is greater than 1MB. For example, these two files:

Server:
343 KB (any decimal)
1,4 MB (one decimal when size > 1MB)

Mobile device:
343 KB (any decimal, right)
1 MB (any decimal, should be shown the first one, as in server side)

Thanks for reading :)

title: Client keeps scanning directory even though it should not be synched
body:
### Expected behaviour

it should be possible to not autosynch/refresh specific folders.
### Actual behaviour

the client is relentless and goes on for hours, ~~synching~~ scanning a folder that was removed locally, until the phone runs out of battery.

i have a directory in my owncloud storage that i do not want to synch on my phone as it's rather big (~2GB). what i've done so far is select the directory in the client, select 'remove' and then 'local copy only'. i'm not sure if this is supposed to disable the synching of this directory from that point on, but as i see no other setting where i can exempt this folder, i guess it should.
### Steps to reproduce
1. have a rather big folder in your owncloud (~2gb in my case)
2. wait.
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1

Device model: Moto G LTE 1st gen

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 1.9.0

ownCloud server version: 8.1.2
### Logs
#### Web server error log

this goes on for hours:

```
PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/that_folder/[...]
```
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)

there are no entries from the time the issue occured.
